Notes: Single-seat 4.5-gen with PS-05/A AESA radar (250 km detection), fly-by-wire, and 6-8 Meteor/AIM-120D missiles for high-Pk BVR; Link-BR2 datalink enables cooperative kills with E-99 cueing to 130 km envelope; 9 operational (1 more delivered Nov 2025) at Anápolis, forming 1st Gripen Squadron for Amazon/Atlantic defense.

Two-seat variant with identical PS-05/A radar and 4-6 Meteor loads for tactics/BVR missions; supports squadron lead and sensor fusion; initial unit IOC 2025, bridging to full 36-aircraft fleet by 2027 for NATO-like interoperability.

Upgraded single-seat with AN/APG-66(V)2 radar (120 km), 4 AIM-120C-5 pylons, and Elta EL/M-2032 add-ons for mid-course guidance; No. 14 Sqn at Santa Cruz, sustains QRA volume until Gripen maturity, extending to 100 km via ground radars.
Two-seat with same AN/APG-66(V)2 and 2-4 AIM-120C-5 missiles for conversion/BVR ops; supports ELINT and two-ship tactics; phase-out by 2029, but 2025 upgrades focus on datalink for E-99 integration.

Navy legacy with AN/APG-66 radar (100 km) and 2-4 AIM-7 Sparrow/AIM-9 Sidewinder for semi-active BVR; modernized avionics (2025) add datalink; Esquadrão VF-1 at São Pedro da Aldeia, enables maritime intercepts to 80 km despite retirement by 2025.
Navy two-seat with identical AN/APG-66 and limited Sparrow loads for training/operational BVR; supports carrier quals and EW fusion; bridging to Gripen NG naval variant trials.

EMB-145-based AEW with Erieye AESA radar (450 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course AIM-120 updates; 1st AIG at Anápolis, critical kill-chain enabler for F-5/Gripen salvos in Amazon theater.
Upgraded Orion with AN/APS-137 radar (300 km) and Harpoon/AGM-84 for over-water BVR cueing; Esquadrão VP-1 at Salvador, provides AEW-like support via datalinks for Navy A-4/F-5 extensions to 120 km.
